fr: Comme nous etions assis l'un a cote de l'autre, un regard brilla soudain dans ses yeux que je n'avais encore surpris.

eng: My lips moved towards hers.
fr: Je lui tendis mes levres.

eng: We kissed each other.
fr: Nous nous embrassames.

eng: I can t describe to you what I felt at that moment.
fr: Je ne puis vous rapporter ce qu'alors je ressentis.

eng: It seemed to me that all my life had been narrowed to one perfect point of rose-coloured joy.
fr: Il me sembla que toute ma vie etait centralisee dans un point de joie couleur de rose.

eng: She trembled all over and shook like a white narcissus. ~~~ Then she flung herself on her knees and kissed my hands.
fr: Elle fut prise d'un tremblement et vacillait comme un blanc narcisse ; elle tomba a mes genoux et me baisa les mains...

eng: I feel that I should not tell you all this, but I can t help it.
fr: Je sens que je ne devrais vous dire cela, mais je ne puis m'en empecher.

eng: Of course, our engagement is a dead secret.
fr: Naturellement notre engagement est un secret ; elle ne l'a meme pas dit a sa mere.

eng: She has not even told her own mother. ~~~ I don t know what my guardians will say.
fr: Je ne sais pas ce que diront mes tuteurs ; lord Radley sera certainement furieux.

eng: Lord Radley is sure to be furious.
I don t care.
fr: Ca m'est egal !

eng: Lips that Shakespeare taught to speak have whispered their secret in my ear.
fr: Les levres auxquelles Shakespeare apprit a parler ont souffle leur secret a mon oreille.

eng: I have had the arms of Rosalind around me, and kissed Juliet on the mouth."
fr: J'ai eu les bras de Rosalinde autour de mon cou et Juliette m'a embrasse sur la bouche.

eng: "Yes, Dorian, I suppose you were right," said Hallward slowly.
fr: -- Oui, Dorian, je crois que vous avez eu raison, dit Hallward lentement.

eng: Hallward laid his hand upon his arm.
fr: Hallward lui mit la main sur le bras.

eng: "Don t, Harry. ~~~ You have annoyed Dorian.
fr: -- Finissez, Harry... Vous desobligez Dorian.

eng: He is not like other men. ~~~ He would never bring misery upon any one. ~~~ His nature is too fine for that."
fr: Il n'est pas comme les autres et ne ferait de peine a personne ; sa nature est trop delicate pour cela.

eng: Lord Henry looked across the table.
fr: Lord Henry regarda par dessus la table.

eng: "Dorian is never annoyed with me," he answered.
fr: -- Je n'ennuie jamais Dorian, repondit-il.

eng: "I asked the question for the best reason possible, for the only reason, indeed, that excuses one for asking any question simple curiosity.
fr: Je lui ai fait cette question pour la meilleure raison possible, pour la seule raison meme qui excuse toute question, la curiosite.

eng: An irrevocable vow.
fr: Un voeu irrevocable.

eng: You mock at it for that.
fr: Vous vous moquez ?...

eng: Ah!
fr: Ah !

eng: All your theories, in fact, Harry." ~~~ "Pleasure is the only thing worth having a theory about," he answered in his slow melodious voice.
fr: Toutes vos theories, en un mot, Harry... -- Le plaisir est la seule chose digne d'avoir une theorie, repondit-il de sa lente voix melodieuse.

eng: "But I am afraid I cannot claim my theory as my own.
fr: Je crois que je ne puis la revendiquer comme mienne.

eng: It belongs to Nature, not to me.
fr: Elle appartient a la Nature, et non pas a moi.

eng: "Yes," echoed Dorian, leaning back in his chair and looking at Lord Henry over the heavy clusters of purple-lipped irises that stood in the centre of the table, "what do you mean by good, Harry?"
fr: -- Oui, reprit Dorian, s'appuyant au dossier de sa chaise, et regardant lord Henry par dessus l'enorme gerbe d'iris aux petales pourpres qui reposait au milieu de la table, qu'entendez-vous par etre bon, Harry ?

eng: "To be good is to be in harmony with one s self," he replied, touching the thin stem of his glass with his pale, fine-pointed fingers. ~~~ "Discord is to be forced to be in harmony with others.
fr: -- Etre bon, c'est etre en harmonie avec soi-meme, repliqua-t-il en caressant de ses fins doigts pales la tige frele de son verre, comme etre mauvais c'est etre en harmonie avec les autres.

eng: One s own life that is the important thing.
fr: Sa propre vie, voila la seule chose importante.

eng: As for the lives of one s neighbours, if one wishes to be a prig or a Puritan, one can flaunt one s moral views about them, but they are not one s concern.
fr: Pour les vies de nos semblables, si on desire etre un faquin ou un puritain, on peut etendre ses vues morales sur elles, mais elles ne nous concernent pas.

eng: Besides, individualism has really the higher aim.
fr: En verite, l'Individualisme est reellement le plus haut but.

eng: Modern morality consists in accepting the standard of one s age.
fr: La moralite moderne consiste a se ranger sous le drapeau de son temps.

eng: "But, surely, if one lives merely for one s self, Harry, one pays a terrible price for doing so?"
fr: -- Mais, parfois, Harry, on paie tres cher le fait de vivre uniquement pour soi, fit remarquer le peintre.

eng: suggested the painter.
fr: -- Bah !

eng: "Yes, we are overcharged for everything nowadays.
fr: Nous sommes imposes pour tout, aujourd'hui...

eng: I should fancy that the real tragedy of the poor is that they can afford nothing but self-denial.
fr: Je m'imagine que le cote vraiment tragique de la vie des pauvres est qu'ils ne peuvent offrir autre chose que le renoncement d'eux-memes...

eng: "Nothing is ever quite true," said Lord Henry.
fr: -- Rien n'est jamais tout a fait vrai, riposta lord Henry.

eng: "This is," interrupted Dorian. ~~~ "You must admit, Harry, that women give to men the very gold of their lives."
fr: -- Si, interrompit Dorian ; vous admettez, Harry, que les femmes donnent aux hommes l'or meme de leurs vies.

eng: "Possibly," he sighed, "but they invariably want it back in such very small change.
fr: -- Possible, ajouta-t-il, mais elles exigent invariablement en retour un petit change.

eng: That is the worry.
fr: La est l'ennui.

eng: Women, as some witty Frenchman once put it, inspire us with the desire to do masterpieces and always prevent us from carrying them out."
fr: Les femmes comme quelque spirituel Francais l'a dit, nous inspirent le desir de faire des chefs-d'oeuvres, mais nous empechent toujours d'en venir a bout.

eng: I don t know why I like you so much."
fr: Je ne sais pourquoi je vous aime autant.

eng: "You will always like me, Dorian," he replied.
fr: -- Vous m'aimerez toujours, Dorian, repliqua-t-il...

eng: "Will you have some coffee, you fellows?
fr: Un peu de cafe, hein, amis !...

eng: What more can one want?
fr: Que desirez-vous de plus ?

eng: Yes, Dorian, you will always be fond of me.
fr: Oui, Dorian, vous m'aimerez toujours.

eng: I represent to you all the sins you have never had the courage to commit."
fr: Je vous represente tous les peches que vous n'avez eu le courage de commettre.

eng: cried the lad, taking a light from a fire-breathing silver dragon that the waiter had placed on the table.
fr: dit le jeune homme en allumant sa cigarette au dragon d'argent vomissant du feu que le domestique avait place sur la table.

eng: "Let us go down to the theatre.
fr: Allons au theatre.

eng: When Sibyl comes on the stage you will have a new ideal of life.
fr: Quand Sibyl apparaitra, vous concevrez un nouvel ideal de vie.

eng: She will represent something to you that you have never known."
fr: Elle vous representera ce que vous n'avez jamais connu.

eng: Still, your wonderful girl may thrill me.
fr: Cependant, votre merveilleuse jeune fille peut m'emouvoir.

eng: I love acting.
fr: J'adore le theatre.

eng: It is so much more real than life.
fr: C'est tellement plus reel que la vie.

eng: I am so sorry, Basil, but there is only room for two in the brougham.
fr: Je suis desole, Basil, mais il n'y a seulement place que pour deux dans mon brougham.

eng: You must follow us in a hansom."
fr: Vous nous suivrez dans un hansom.

eng: They got up and put on their coats, sipping their coffee standing.
fr: Ils se leverent et endosserent leurs pardessus, en buvant debout leurs cafes.

eng: The painter was silent and preoccupied. ~~~ There was a gloom over him.
fr: Le peintre demeurait silencieux et preoccupe ; un lourd ennui semblait peser sur lui.

eng: He could not bear this marriage, and yet it seemed to him to be better than many other things that might have happened.
fr: Il ne pouvait approuver ce mariage, et cependant cela lui semblait preferable a d'autres choses qui auraient pu arriver...

eng: After a few minutes, they all passed downstairs.
fr: Quelques minutes apres, ils etaient en bas.

eng: He drove off by himself, as had been arranged, and watched the flashing lights of the little brougham in front of him.
fr: Il conduisit lui-meme, comme c'etait convenu, guettant les lanternes brillantes du petit brougham qui marchait devant lui.

eng: He felt that Dorian Gray would never again be to him all that he had been in the past.
fr: Il sentait que Dorian Gray ne serait jamais a lui comme par le passe.

eng: Life had come between them.... His eyes darkened, and the crowded flaring streets became blurred to his eyes.
fr: La vie etait survenue entre eux...

eng: When the cab drew up at the theatre, it seemed to him that he had grown years older. ~~~ CHAPTER VII.
fr: Ses yeux s'embrumerent, et ils ne virent plus les rues populeuses etincelantes de lumiere...

eng: For some reason or other, the house was crowded that night, and the fat Jew manager who met them at the door was beaming from ear to ear with an oily tremulous smile.
fr: Quand la voiture s'arreta devant le theatre, il lui sembla qu'il etait plus vieux d'annees... VII Par hasard, il se trouva que la salle, ce soir-la, etait pleine de monde, et le gras manager juif, qui les recut a la porte du theatre rayonnait d'une oreille a l'autre d'un onctueux et tremblotant sourire.

eng: Hallward amused himself with watching the faces in the pit.
fr: Hallward s'amusa a observer les personnes du parterre...

eng: The heat was terribly oppressive, and the huge sunlight flamed like a monstrous dahlia with petals of yellow fire.
fr: La chaleur etait suffocante et le lustre enorme avait l'air, tout flambant, d'un monstrueux dahlia aux petales de feu jaune.

eng: The youths in the gallery had taken off their coats and waistcoats and hung them over the side.
fr: Les jeunes gens des galeries avaient retire leurs jaquettes et leurs gilets et se penchaient sur les balustrades.

eng: They talked to each other across the theatre and shared their oranges with the tawdry girls who sat beside them.
fr: Ils echangeaient des paroles d'un bout a l'autre du theatre et partageaient des oranges avec des filles habillees de couleurs voyantes, assises a cote d'eux.

eng: Some women were laughing in the pit.
fr: Quelques femmes riaient au parterre.

eng: The sound of the popping of corks came from the bar.
fr: Un bruit de bouchons sautant arrivait du bar.

eng: "What a place to find one s divinity in!" ~~~ said Lord Henry.
fr: -- Quel endroit pour y rencontrer sa divinite, dit lord Henry.

eng: "Yes!" ~~~ answered Dorian Gray.
fr: -- Oui, repondit Dorian Gray.

eng: "It was here I found her, and she is divine beyond all living things.
fr: C'est ici que je la rencontrai, et elle est divine au-dela de tout ce qu'on peut concevoir.

eng: When she acts, you will forget everything.
fr: Vous oublierez toute chose quand elle jouera.

eng: These common rough people, with their coarse faces and brutal gestures, become quite different when she is on the stage. ~~~ They sit silently and watch her.
fr: On ne fait plus attention a cette populace rude et commune, aux figures grossieres et aux gestes brutaux des qu'elle entre en scene ; ces gens demeurent silencieux et la regardent ; ils pleurent, et rient comme elle le veut ; elle joue sur eux comme sur un violon ; elle les spiritualise, en quelque sorte, et l'on sent qu'ils ont la meme chair et le meme sang que soi-meme.

eng: They weep and laugh as she wills them to do.
fr: -- La meme chair et le meme sang que soi-meme !

eng: She makes them as responsive as a violin.
She spiritualizes them, and one feels that they are of the same flesh and blood as one s self."
"The same flesh and blood as one s self!
Oh, I hope not!"
fr: Oh !

eng: exclaimed Lord Henry, who was scanning the occupants of the gallery through his opera-glass.
fr: je ne crois pas, s'exclama lord Henry qui passait en revue les spectateurs de la galerie avec sa lorgnette.

eng: "Don t pay any attention to him, Dorian," said the painter.
fr: -- Ne faites pas attention a lui, Dorian, dit le peintre.

eng: "I understand what you mean, and I believe in this girl.
fr: Je sais, moi, ce que vous voulez dire et je crois en cette jeune fille.

eng: Any one you love must be marvellous, and any girl who has the effect you describe must be fine and noble.
fr: Quiconque vous aimez doit le meriter et la personne qui a produit sur vous l'effet que vous nous avez decrit doit etre noble et intelligente.

eng: To spiritualize one s age that is something worth doing.
fr: Spiritualiser ses contemporains, c'est quelque chose d'appreciable...

eng: "I knew that you would understand me.
fr: Je savais que vous me comprendriez.

eng: Harry is so cynical, he terrifies me. ~~~ But here is the orchestra.
fr: Harry est tellement cynique qu'il me terrifie parfois... Ah !

eng: It is quite dreadful, but it only lasts for about five minutes.
fr: voici l'orchestre ; il est epouvantable, mais ca ne dure que cinq minutes.

eng: Basil Hallward leaped to his feet and began to applaud.
fr: Basil Hallward se dressa et commenca a l'applaudir.

eng: Motionless, and as one in a dream, sat Dorian Gray, gazing at her. ~~~ Lord Henry peered through his glasses, murmuring, "Charming!
fr: Sans mouvement, comme dans un reve, Dorian Gray la regardait ; Lord Henry la lorgnant a l'aide de sa jumelle murmurait : << Charmante !

eng: charming!"
fr: Charmante !

eng: Her body swayed, while she danced, as a plant sways in the water.
fr: Son corps s'inclinait, pendant qu'elle dansait, comme dans l'eau s'incline un roseau.

eng: The curves of her throat were the curves of a white lily.
fr: Les courbes de sa poitrine semblaient les courbes d'un blanc lys.

eng: Her hands seemed to be made of cool ivory.
fr: Ses mains etaient faites d'un pur ivoire.

eng: The few words she had to speak Good pilgrim, you do wrong your hand too much, Which mannerly devotion shows in this; For saints have hands that pilgrims hands do touch, And palm to palm is holy palmers kiss with the brief dialogue that follows, were spoken in a thoroughly artificial manner. ~~~ The voice was exquisite, but from the point of view of tone it was absolutely false. ~~~ It was wrong in colour. ~~~ It took away all the life from the verse.
fr: Le peu de mots qu'elle avait a dire : Good pilgrim, you do wrong your hand too much Which mannerly devotion shows in this ; For saints have bands that pilgrims' hands do touch And palm to palm is holy palmers' kiss...[1] et le bref dialogue qui suit, furent dits d'une maniere plutot artificielle... Sa voix etait exquise, mais au point de vue de l'intonation, c'etait absolument faux.

eng: It made the passion unreal.
fr: La couleur n'y etait pas.

eng: Dorian Gray grew pale as he watched her. ~~~ He was puzzled and anxious.
fr: Toute la vie du vers etait enlevee ; on n'y sentait pas la realite de la passion.

eng: Neither of his friends dared to say anything to him. ~~~ She seemed to them to be absolutely incompetent.
fr: Dorian palit en l'observant, etonne, anxieux... Aucun de ses amis n'osait lui parler ; elle leur semblait sans aucun talent ; ils etaient tout a fait desappointes.

eng: Sweet, good-night!
fr: >> Sweet, good-night !

eng: This bud of love by summer s ripening breath May prove a beauteous flower when next we meet she spoke the words as though they conveyed no meaning to her.
fr: This bud of love by Summer's ripening breath May prove a beauteous flower when next we meet...[3] Elle les dit comme s'ils ne comportaient pour elle aucune espece de signification ; ce n'etait pas nervosite, bien au contraire ; elle paraissait absolument consciente de ce qu'elle faisait.

eng: It was not nervousness.
fr: C'etait simplement du mauvais art ; l'echec etait parfait.

eng: Indeed, so far from being nervous, she was absolutely self-contained. ~~~ It was simply bad art.
fr: Meme les auditeurs vulgaires et depourvus de toute education, du parterre et des galeries, perdaient tout interet a la piece.

eng: She was a complete failure.
fr: Ils commencerent a s'agiter, a parler haut, a siffler...

eng: Even the common uneducated audience of the pit and gallery lost their interest in the play.
fr: Le manager israelite, debout au fond du parterre, frappait du pied et jurait de rage.

eng: They got restless, and began to talk loudly and to whistle.
fr: L'on eut dit que la seule personne calme etait la jeune fille.

eng: The Jew manager, who was standing at the back of the dress-circle, stamped and swore with rage.
The only person unmoved was the girl herself.
fr: Un tonnerre de sifflets suivit la chute du rideau...

eng: When the second act was over, there came a storm of hisses, and Lord Henry got up from his chair and put on his coat.
fr: Lord Henry se leva et mit son pardessus... -- Elle est tres belle, Dorian, dit-il, mais elle ne sait pas jouer.

eng: "She is quite beautiful, Dorian," he said, "but she can t act. ~~~ Let us go." ~~~ "I am going to see the play through," answered the lad, in a hard bitter voice.
fr: Allons-nous-en... -- Je veux voir entierement la piece, repondit le jeune homme d'une voix rauque et amere.

eng: "I am awfully sorry that I have made you waste an evening, Harry.
fr: Je suis desespere de vous avoir fait perdre votre soiree, Harry.

eng: I apologize to you both."
fr: Je vous fais mes excuses a tous deux.

eng: "My dear Dorian, I should think Miss Vane was ill," interrupted Hallward.
fr: -- Mon cher Dorian, miss Vane devait etre indisposee.

eng: "We will come some other night."
"I wish she were ill," he rejoined.
fr: Nous viendrons la voir quelque autre soir.

eng: "But she seems to me to be simply callous and cold. ~~~ She has entirely altered.
fr: -- Je desire qu'elle l'ait ete, continua-t-il ; mais elle me semble, a moi, insensible et froide.

eng: Last night she was a great artist.
fr: Elle est entierement changee.

eng: This evening she is merely a commonplace mediocre actress."
fr: Hier, ce fut une grande artiste ; ce soir, c'est une actrice mediocre et commune.

eng: "Don t talk like that about any one you love, Dorian.
fr: -- Ne parlez pas ainsi de ce que vous aimez, Dorian.

eng: Love is a more wonderful thing than art."
fr: L'amour est une plus merveilleuse chose que l'art.

eng: "But do let us go.
fr: Mais allons-nous-en !...

eng: Dorian, you must not stay here any longer.
fr: Dorian, vous ne pouvez rester ici davantage.

eng: It is not good for one s morals to see bad acting.
fr: Ce n'est pas bon pour l'esprit de voir jouer mal.

eng: The secret of remaining young is never to have an emotion that is unbecoming.
fr: Le secret de rester jeune est de ne jamais avoir une emotion malseante.

eng: Come to the club with Basil and myself. ~~~ We will smoke cigarettes and drink to the beauty of Sibyl Vane.
fr: Venez au club avec Basil et moi, nous fumerons des cigarettes en buvant a la beaute de Sibyl Vane ; elle est certainement belle : que desirez-vous de plus ?

eng: She is beautiful.
fr: -- Allez-vous-en, Harry !

eng: What more can you want?"
fr: cria l'enfant.

eng: "Go away, Harry," cried the lad.
fr: J'ai besoin d'etre seul.

eng: "I want to be alone. ~~~ Basil, you must go.
fr: Basil, vous aussi, allez-vous-en !

eng: Ah!
fr: Ah !

eng: The hot tears came to his eyes. ~~~ His lips trembled, and rushing to the back of the box, he leaned up against the wall, hiding his face in his hands.
fr: Des larmes brulantes lui emplirent les yeux ; ses levres tremblerent et se precipitant au fond de la loge, il s'appuya contre la cloison et cacha sa face dans ses mains... -- Allons-nous-en, Basil, dit lord Henry d'une voix etrangement tendre.

eng: "Let us go, Basil," said Lord Henry with a strange tenderness in his voice, and the two young men passed out together.
fr: Et les deux jeunes gens sortirent ensemble.

eng: A few moments afterwards the footlights flared up and the curtain rose on the third act.
fr: Quelques instants plus tard, la rampe s'illumina, et le rideau se leva sur le troisieme acte.

eng: Dorian Gray went back to his seat. ~~~ He looked pale, and proud, and indifferent.
fr: Dorian Gray reprit son siege ; il etait pale, mais dedaigneux et indifferent.

eng: The play dragged on, and seemed interminable.
fr: L'action se trainait, interminable.

eng: The whole thing was a _fiasco_.
fr: Le fiasco etait complet.

eng: The last act was played to almost empty benches.
fr: Le dernier acte fut joue devant les banquettes.

eng: The curtain went down on a titter and some groans.
fr: Le rideau s'abaissa sur des murmures ou des grognements.

eng: As soon as it was over, Dorian Gray rushed behind the scenes into the greenroom.
fr: Aussitot que ce fut fini, Dorian Gray se precipita par les coulisses vers le foyer...

eng: The girl was standing there alone, with a look of triumph on her face.
fr: Il y trouva la jeune fille seule ; un regard de triomphe eclairait sa face.

eng: "Horribly!"
fr: -- Horriblement !

eng: he answered, gazing at her in amazement.
fr: repondit-il, la considerant avec stupefaction... Horriblement !

eng: "Horribly!
fr: Ce fut affreux !

eng: It was dreadful. ~~~ Are you ill?
fr: Vous etiez malade, n'est-ce pas ?

eng: You have no idea what it was.
fr: Vous ne vous doutez point de ce que cela fut !...

eng: You have no idea what I suffered." ~~~ The girl smiled.
fr: Vous n'avez pas idee de ce que j'ai souffert !

eng: "Dorian," she answered, lingering over his name with long-drawn music in her voice, as though it were sweeter than honey to the red petals of her mouth. ~~~ "Dorian, you should have understood. ~~~ But you understand now, don t you?"
fr: La jeune fille sourit... -- Dorian, repondit-elle, appuyant sur son prenom d'une voix trainante et musicale, comme s'il eut ete plus doux que miel aux rouges petales de sa bouche, Dorian, vous auriez du comprendre, mais vous comprenez maintenant, n'est-ce pas ?

eng: "Understand what?"
fr: -- Comprendre quoi ?

eng: he asked, angrily.
"Why I was so bad to-night.
Why I shall always be bad. ~~~ Why I shall never act well again."
fr: demanda-t-il, rageur... -- Pourquoi je fus si mauvaise ce soir !

eng: He shrugged his shoulders. ~~~ "You are ill, I suppose.
fr: Pourquoi je serai toujours mauvaise !...

eng: When you are ill you shouldn t act. ~~~ You make yourself ridiculous.
fr: Pourquoi je ne jouerai plus jamais bien !...

eng: My friends were bored.
fr: Il leva les epaules.

eng: I was bored." ~~~ She seemed not to listen to him. ~~~ She was transfigured with joy.
fr: -- Vous etes malade, je crois ; quand vous etes malade, vous ne pouvez jouer : vous paraissez absolument ridicule.

eng: An ecstasy of happiness dominated her.
fr: Vous nous avez navres, mes amis et moi.

eng: "Dorian, Dorian," she cried, "before I knew you, acting was the one reality of my life. ~~~ It was only in the theatre that I lived.
fr: Elle ne semblait plus l'ecouter ; transfiguree de joie, elle paraissait en proie a une extase de bonheur !...

eng: I thought that it was all true.
fr: -- Dorian !

eng: I was Rosalind one night and Portia the other. ~~~ The joy of Beatrice was my joy, and the sorrows of Cordelia were mine also.
fr: Dorian, s'ecria-t-elle, avant de vous connaitre, je croyais que la seule realite de la vie etait le theatre : c'etait seulement pour le theatre que je vivais ; je pensais que tout cela etait vrai ; j'etais une nuit Rosalinde, et l'autre, Portia : la joie de Beatrice etait ma joie, et les tristesses de Cordelia furent miennes !...

eng: What have I to do with the puppets of a play?
fr: Que puis-je avoir de commun avec les fantoches d'un drame ?

eng: When I came on to-night, I could not understand how it was that everything had gone from me.
fr: Quand j'arrivai ce soir, je ne pus comprendre comment cela m'avait quittee.

eng: I thought that I was going to be wonderful. ~~~ I found that I could do nothing.
fr: Je pensais que j'allais etre merveilleuse et je m'apercus que je ne pouvais rien faire.

eng: Oh, Dorian, Dorian, you understand now what it signifies?
fr: Dorian ! ~~~ Dorian, tu comprends maintenant ce que cela signifie.

eng: Even if I could do it, it would be profanation for me to play at being in love.
fr: Meme si je parvenais a le faire, ce serait une profanation, car pour moi, desormais, jouer, c'est d'etre amoureuse !

eng: You have made me see that."
fr: Voila ce que tu m'as faite !...

eng: He flung himself down on the sofa and turned away his face.
fr: Il tomba sur le sofa et detourna la tete.

eng: She came across to him, and with her little fingers stroked his hair.
fr: Elle vint pres de lui et de ses petits doigts lui caressa les cheveux.

eng: She knelt down and pressed his hands to her lips.
fr: Elle s'agenouilla, lui baisant les mains...

eng: He drew them away, and a shudder ran through him.
fr: Il les retira, pris d'un fremissement.

eng: "Yes," he cried, "you have killed my love.
fr: -- Oui, clama-t-il, vous avez tue mon amour !

eng: You used to stir my imagination.
fr: Vous avez deroute mon esprit !

eng: Now you don t even stir my curiosity.
fr: Maintenant vous ne pouvez meme exciter ma curiosite !

eng: You simply produce no effect.
fr: Vous n'avez plus aucun effet sur moi !

eng: I loved you because you were marvellous, because you had genius and intellect, because you realized the dreams of great poets and gave shape and substance to the shadows of art.
fr: Je vous aimais parce que vous etiez admirable, parce que vous etiez intelligente et geniale, parce que vous realisiez les reves des grands poetes et que vous donniez une forme, un corps, aux ombres de l'Art !

eng: You have thrown it all away.
fr: Vous avez jete tout cela !

eng: You are shallow and stupid.
fr: vous etes stupide et bornee !...

eng: My God!
fr: Mon Dieu !

eng: You are nothing to me now.
fr: Vous ne m'etes plus rien !

eng: I will never see you again.
fr: Je ne veux plus vous voir !

eng: I will never think of you.
fr: Je ne veux plus penser a vous !

eng: I will never mention your name.
fr: Je ne veux plus me rappeler votre nom !

eng: You don t know what you were to me, once.
fr: Vous ne pouvez vous douter ce que vous etiez pour moi, autrefois...

eng: Why, once ... Oh, I can t bear to think of it!
fr: Autrefois !... ~~~ Ah !

eng: I wish I had never laid eyes upon you!
fr: je ne veux plus penser a cela !

eng: You have spoiled the romance of my life.
fr: Je desirerais ne vous avoir jamais vue... Vous avez brise le roman de ma vie !

eng: How little you can know of love, if you say it mars your art!
fr: Comme vous connaissez peu l'amour, pour penser qu'il eut pu gater votre art !...

eng: The girl grew white, and trembled.
fr: La jeune fille palissait et tremblait.

eng: She clenched her hands together, and her voice seemed to catch in her throat. ~~~ "You are not serious, Dorian?"
fr: Elle joignit les mains, et d'une voix qui s'arreta dans la gorge : -- Vous n'etes pas serieux, Dorian, murmura-t-elle ; vous jouez !...

eng: she murmured.
fr: -- Je joue !...

eng: "You are acting."
"Acting! ~~~ I leave that to you. ~~~ You do it so well," he answered bitterly.
fr: C'est bon pour vous, cela ; vous y reussissez si bien, repondit-il amerement.

eng: She rose from her knees and, with a piteous expression of pain in her face, came across the room to him.
fr: Elle se releva, et une expression pitoyable de douleur sur la figure, elle traversa le foyer et vint vers lui.

eng: "Dorian, Dorian, don t leave me!" ~~~ she whispered.
fr: -- Dorian, Dorian, ne m'abandonnez pas, souffla-t-elle.

eng: "I am so sorry I didn t act well. ~~~ I was thinking of you all the time.
fr: Je suis desolee d'avoir si mal joue ; je pensais a vous tout le temps ; mais j'essaierai... oui, j'essaierai...

eng: But I will try indeed, I will try.
fr: Cela me vint si vite, cet amour pour vous...

eng: It came so suddenly across me, my love for you.
fr: Je pense que je l'eusse toujours ignore si vous ne m'aviez pas embrasse...

eng: I think I should never have known it if you had not kissed me if we had not kissed each other.
fr: Si nous ne nous etions pas embrasses... Embrasse-moi encore, mon amour... Ne t'en va pas !

eng: Kiss me again, my love.
fr: Je ne pourrais le supporter !

eng: Don t go away from me.
I couldn t bear it.
Oh!
fr: Oh !

eng: He didn t mean it. ~~~ He was in jest....
fr: Il ne voulait pas dire cela... il plaisantait !...

eng: But you, oh! ~~~ can t you forgive me for to-night?
fr: Mais vous, pouvez-vous m'oublier a cause de ce soir ?

eng: I will work so hard and try to improve.
fr: Je veux tant travailler et essayer de faire des progres.

eng: After all, it is only once that I have not pleased you.
fr: Apres tout, c'est la seule fois que je t'ai deplu...

eng: But you are quite right, Dorian.
fr: Tu as raison. ~~~ Dorian...

eng: I should have shown myself more of an artist.
fr: J'aurais du me montrer mieux qu'une artiste...
C'etait fou de ma part... et cependant, je n'ai pu faire autrement... Oh !

eng: It was foolish of me, and yet I couldn t help it.
fr: ne me quitte pas ! ~~~ ne m'abandonne pas !...

eng: Oh, don t leave me, don t leave me."
fr: Une rafale de sanglots passionnes la courba...

eng: A fit of passionate sobbing choked her.
fr: Elle s'ecrasa sur le plancher comme une chose blessee.

eng: She crouched on the floor like a wounded thing, and Dorian Gray, with his beautiful eyes, looked down at her, and his chiselled lips curled in exquisite disdain.
fr: Dorian Gray la regardait a terre, ses levres fines retroussees en un supreme dedain.

eng: Sibyl Vane seemed to him to be absurdly melodramatic. ~~~ Her tears and sobs annoyed him.
fr: Ses larmes et ses sanglots l'ennuyaient... -- Je m'en vais, dit-il, d'une calme voix claire.

eng: "I am going," he said at last in his calm clear voice.
fr: Je ne veux pas etre cruel davantage, mais je ne puis vous revoir.

eng: "I don t wish to be unkind, but I can t see you again.
fr: Vous m'avez depouille de toutes mes illusions...

eng: You have disappointed me." ~~~ She wept silently, and made no answer, but crept nearer. ~~~ Her little hands stretched blindly out, and appeared to be seeking for him.
fr: Elle pleurait silencieusement, et ne fit point de reponse ; rampante, elle se rapprocha ; ses petites mains se tendirent comme celles d'un aveugle et semblerent le chercher...

eng: He turned on his heel and left the room.
fr: Il tourna sur ses talons et quitta le foyer.

eng: In a few moments he was out of the theatre.
fr: Quelques instants apres, il etait dehors... Ou il alla ?...

eng: Where he went to he hardly knew.
fr: il ne s'en souvint.

eng: He remembered wandering through dimly lit streets, past gaunt, black-shadowed archways and evil-looking houses. ~~~ Women with hoarse voices and harsh laughter had called after him.
fr: Il se rappela vaguement avoir vagabonde par des rues mal eclairees, passe sous des voutes sombres et devant des maisons aux facades hostiles... Des femmes, avec des voix enrouees et des rires erailles l'avaient appele.

eng: Under the portico, with its grey, sun-bleached pillars, loitered a troop of draggled bareheaded girls, waiting for the auction to be over. ~~~ Others crowded round the swinging doors of the coffee-house in the piazza.
fr: Sous le portique aux piliers grisatres, musait une troupe de filles tetes nues attendant la fin des encheres... D'autres, s'ebattaient aux alentours des portes sans cesse ouvertes des bars de la Piazza.

eng: The heavy cart-horses slipped and stamped upon the rough stones, shaking their bells and trappings.
Some of the drivers were lying asleep on a pile of sacks. ~~~ Iris-necked and pink-footed, the pigeons ran about picking up seeds.
fr: Les enormes chevaux de camions glissaient ou frappaient du pied sur les paves raboteux, faisant sonner leurs cloches et leurs harnais...

eng: After a little while, he hailed a hansom and drove home.
fr: Quelques conducteurs gisaient endormis sur des piles de sacs.

eng: For a few moments he loitered upon the doorstep, looking round at the silent square, with its blank, close-shuttered windows and its staring blinds.
fr: Des pigeons, aux cous irises, aux pattes roses, voltigeaient, picorant des graines... Au bout de quelques instants, il hela un hansom et se fit conduire chez lui...

eng: The sky was pure opal now, and the roofs of the houses glistened like silver against it.
fr: Un moment, il s'attarda sur le seuil, regardant devant lui le square silencieux, les fenetres fermees, les persiennes claires...

eng: From some chimney opposite a thin wreath of smoke was rising. ~~~ It curled, a violet riband, through the nacre-coloured air.
fr: Le ciel s'opalisait maintenant, et les toits des maisons luisaient comme de l'argent... D'une cheminee en face, un fin filet de fumee s'elevait ; il ondula, comme un ruban violet a travers l'atmosphere couleur de nacre...

eng: It was certainly strange.
fr: C'etait vraiment etrange !...

eng: He turned round and, walking to the window, drew up the blind.
fr: Il se tourna, et, marchant vers la fenetre, tira les rideaux...

eng: The bright dawn flooded the room and swept the fantastic shadows into dusky corners, where they lay shuddering.
fr: Une brillante clarte emplit la chambre et balaya les ombres fantastiques des coins obscurs ou elles flottaient.

eng: But the strange expression that he had noticed in the face of the portrait seemed to linger there, to be more intensified even.
fr: L'etrange expression qu'il avait surprise dans la face y demeurait, plus perceptible encore...

eng: He winced and, taking up from the table an oval glass framed in ivory Cupids, one of Lord Henry s many presents to him, glanced hurriedly into its polished depths.
fr: Il recula, et prenant sur la table une glace ovale entouree de petits amours d'ivoire, un des nombreux presents de lord Henry, se hata de se regarder dans ses profondeurs polies...

eng: No line like that warped his red lips.
fr: Nulle ligne comme celle-la ne tourmentait l'ecarlate de ses levres... Qu'est-ce que cela voulait dire ?
Il frotta ses yeux, s'approcha plus encore du tableau et l'examina de nouveau... Personne n'y avait touche, certes, et cependant, il etait hors de doute que quelque chose y avait ete change...

eng: What did it mean?
fr: Il ne revait pas !

eng: He rubbed his eyes, and came close to the picture, and examined it again.
fr: La chose etait horriblement apparente...

eng: There were no signs of any change when he looked into the actual painting, and yet there was no doubt that the whole expression had altered.
fr: Il se jeta dans un fauteuil et rappela ses esprits... Soudainement, lui revint ce qu'il avait dit dans l'atelier de Basil le jour meme ou le portrait avait ete termine.

eng: It was not a mere fancy of his own.
fr: Oui, il s'en souvenait parfaitement.

eng: The thing was horribly apparent. ~~~ He threw himself into a chair and began to think.
fr: Il avait enonce le desir fou de rester jeune alors que vieillirait ce tableau... Ah !

eng: Suddenly there flashed across his mind what he had said in Basil Hallward s studio the day the picture had been finished. ~~~ Yes, he remembered it perfectly.
fr: si sa beaute pouvait ne pas se ternir et qu'il fut donne a ce portrait peint sur cette toile de porter le poids de ses passions, de ses peches !...

eng: He had uttered a mad wish that he himself might remain young, and the portrait grow old; that his own beauty might be untarnished, and the face on the canvas bear the burden of his passions and his sins; that the painted image might be seared with the lines of suffering and thought, and that he might keep all the delicate bloom and loveliness of his then just conscious boyhood.
fr: Cette peinture ne pouvait-elle donc etre marquee des lignes de souffrance et de doute, alors que lui-meme garderait l'epanouissement delicat et la joliesse de son adolescence !

eng: Surely his wish had not been fulfilled?
fr: Son voeu, pardieu !

eng: Such things were impossible.
fr: ne pouvait etre exauce !

eng: It seemed monstrous even to think of them.
fr: De telles choses sont impossibles !

eng: And, yet, there was the picture before him, with the touch of cruelty in the mouth.
fr: C'etait meme monstrueux de les evoquer... Et, cependant, le portrait etait devant lui portant a la bouche une moue de cruaute !

eng: He had dreamed of her as a great artist, had given his love to her because he had thought her great.
fr: Il l'avait revee une grande artiste, lui avait donne son amour parce qu'il l'avait crue geniale...

eng: Then she had disappointed him.
fr: Elle l'avait desappointe.

eng: She had been shallow and unworthy.
fr: Elle s'etait montree quelconque, indigne...

eng: During the three terrible hours that the play had lasted, he had lived centuries of pain, aeon upon aeon of torture.
fr: Pendant les trois heures qu'avait dure la piece, il avait vecu des siecles de douleur, des eternites sur des eternites de torture !...

eng: His life was well worth hers. ~~~ She had marred him for a moment, if he had wounded her for an age.
fr: Sa vie valait bien la sienne... S'il l'avait blessee, n'avait-elle pas, de son cote, enlaidi son existence ?...

eng: Besides, women were better suited to bear sorrow than men. ~~~ They lived on their emotions.
fr: D'ailleurs, les femmes sont mieux organisees que les hommes pour supporter les chagrins...

eng: They only thought of their emotions.
fr: Elles vivent d'emotions ; elles ne pensent qu'a cela...

eng: When they took lovers, it was merely to have some one with whom they could have scenes.
fr: Quand elles prennent des amants, c'est simplement pour avoir quelqu'un a qui elles puissent faire des scenes.

eng: But the picture?
fr: Mais le portrait ?...

eng: What was he to say of that?
fr: Que dire de cela ?

eng: It held the secret of his life, and told his story. ~~~ It had taught him to love his own beauty.
fr: Il possedait le secret de sa vie, en revelait l'histoire ; il lui avait appris a aimer sa propre beaute.

eng: It was folly to think so.
fr: C'etait folie d'y songer...

eng: Yet it was watching him, with its beautiful marred face and its cruel smile.
fr: Cependant, il le regardait avec sa belle figure ravagee, son cruel sourire... Sa brillante chevelure rayonnait dans le soleil du matin.

eng: Its bright hair gleamed in the early sunlight.
fr: Ses yeux d'azur rencontrerent les siens.

eng: Its blue eyes met his own.
A sense of infinite pity, not for himself, but for the painted image of himself, came over him.
fr: Un sentiment d'infinie pitie, non pour lui-meme, mais pour son image peinte, le saisit.

eng: Its gold would wither into grey.
fr: L'or se ternirait...

eng: Its red and white roses would die.
fr: Les rouges et blanches roses de son teint se fletriraient.

eng: For every sin that he committed, a stain would fleck and wreck its fairness.
fr: Pour chaque peche qu'il commettrait, une tache s'ajouterait aux autres taches, recouvrant peu a peu sa beaute...

eng: Yes, it was his duty to do so.
fr: Oui, c'etait son devoir.

eng: She must have suffered more than he had.
fr: Elle avait souffert plus que lui.

eng: Poor child!
fr: Pauvre enfant !

eng: The fascination that she had exercised over him would return. ~~~ They would be happy together.
fr: Elle reprendrait sur lui la fascination de jadis ; ils seraient heureux ensemble.

eng: His life with her would be beautiful and pure.
fr: La vie, a cote d'elle, serait belle et pure.

eng: He got up from his chair and drew a large screen right in front of the portrait, shuddering as he glanced at it. ~~~ "How horrible!"
fr: Il se leva du fauteuil, tira un haut et large paravent devant le portrait, frissonnant encore pendant qu'il le regardait... << Quelle horreur !

eng: he murmured to himself, and he walked across to the window and opened it.
fr: >> pensait-il, en allant ouvrir la porte-fenetre...

eng: When he stepped out on to the grass, he drew a deep breath.
fr: Quand il fut sur le gazon, il poussa un profond soupir.

eng: The fresh morning air seemed to drive away all his sombre passions.
fr: L'air frais du matin parut dissiper toutes ses noires pensees, il songeait seulement a Sibyl.

eng: He thought only of Sibyl.
fr: Un echo affaibli de son amour lui revint.

eng: A faint echo of his love came back to him.
fr: Il repeta son nom, et le repeta encore.

Les oiseaux qui chantaient dans le jardin plein de rosee, semblaient parler d'elle aux fleurs... | Bon pelerin, vous etes trop severe pour votre main Qui n'a fait preuve en ceci que d'une respectueuse devotion ; Les saintes memes ont des mains que peuvent toucher les mains des pelerins Et cette etreinte est un pieu baiser... | Tu sais que le masque de la nuit est sur mon visage, Sans cela tu verrais une virginale rougeur colorer ma joue Quand je songe aux paroles que tu m'as entendu dire cette nuit... | Quoique tu fasses ma joie, Je ne puis gouter cette nuit toutes les joies de notre rapprochement : Il est trop brusque, trop imprevu, trop soudain, Trop semblable a l'eclair qui a cesse d'etre Avant qu'on ait pu dire : << Il brille !

eng: He repeated her name over and over again.
fr: Doux ami, bonne nuit !

eng: The birds that were singing in the dew-drenched garden seemed to be telling the flowers about her. ~~~ CHAPTER VIII. ~~~ It was long past noon when he awoke.
fr: Ce bouton d'amour, muri par l'haleine de l'ete Pourra devenir une belle fleur, a notre prochaine entrevue... VIII Midi avait sonne depuis longtemps, quand il s'eveilla.

eng: His valet had crept several times on tiptoe into the room to see if he was stirring, and had wondered what made his young master sleep so late.
fr: Son valet etait venu plusieurs fois sur la pointe du pied dans la chambre voir s'il dormait encore, et s'etait demande ce qui pouvait bien retenir si tard au lit son jeune maitre.

eng: Finally his bell sounded, and Victor came in softly with a cup of tea, and a pile of letters, on a small tray of old Sevres china, and drew back the olive-satin curtains, with their shimmering blue lining, that hung in front of the three tall windows. ~~~ "Monsieur has well slept this morning," he said, smiling.
fr: Finalement, Victor entendit retentir le timbre et il arriva doucement, portant une tasse de the et un paquet de lettres sur un petit plateau de vieux Sevres chinois ; il tira les rideaux de satin olive, aux dessins bleus, tendus devant les trois grandes fenetres... -- Monsieur a bien dormi ce matin, remarqua-t-il souriant.

eng: "What o clock is it, Victor?" ~~~ asked Dorian Gray drowsily.
fr: -- Quelle heure est-il, Victor, demanda Dorian Gray, paresseusement.

eng: "One hour and a quarter, Monsieur."
fr: -- Une heure un quart, Monsieur.

eng: Suddenly his eye fell on the screen that he had placed in front of the portrait, and he started. ~~~ "Too cold for Monsieur?" ~~~ asked his valet, putting an omelette on the table.
fr: Ses regards tout a coup, tomberent sur le paravent qu'il avait place devant le portrait et il tressaillit... -- Monsieur a froid, demanda le valet en servant une omelette.

eng: "I shut the window?" ~~~ Dorian shook his head.
fr: Je vais fermer la fenetre... Dorian secoua la tete.

eng: "I am not cold," he murmured.
fr: -- Je n'ai pas froid, murmura-t-il.

eng: He almost dreaded his valet leaving the room. ~~~ He knew that when he was alone he would have to examine the portrait.
fr: Il craignit presque que le valet quittat la chambre, car il savait, il savait qu'il courrait encore contempler le portrait, sitot seul...

eng: He was afraid of certainty.
fr: Il en etait sur.

eng: When the coffee and cigarettes had been brought and the man turned to go, he felt a wild desire to tell him to remain.
fr: Quand le domestique, apres avoir servi le cafe et les cigarettes, se dirigea vers la porte, il se sentit un violent desir de lui dire de rester.

eng: As the door was closing behind him, he called him back.
fr: Comme la porte se fermait derriere lui, il le rappela...

eng: The man stood waiting for his orders. ~~~ Dorian looked at him for a moment.
fr: Le domestique demeurait immobile, attendant les ordres... Dorian le regarda.

eng: "I am not at home to any one, Victor," he said with a sigh.
fr: -- Je n'y suis pour personne, Victor, dit-il avec un soupir.

eng: The man bowed and retired.
fr: L'homme s'inclina et disparut...

eng: Why not let it stay there?
fr: Pourquoi pas le laisser la ?

eng: What was the use of knowing?
fr: A quoi bon savoir ?

eng: If the thing was true, it was terrible.
fr: Si c'etait vrai, c'etait terrible ?...

eng: If it was not true, why trouble about it?
fr: Sinon, cela ne valait la peine que l'on s'en occupat...

eng: But what if, by some fate or deadlier chance, eyes other than his spied behind and saw the horrible change?
fr: Mais si, par un hasard malheureux, d'autres yeux que les siens decouvraient le portrait et en constataient l'horrible changement ?...

eng: What should he do if Basil Hallward came and asked to look at his own picture?
fr: Que ferait-il, si Basil Hallward venait et demandait a revoir son propre tableau.

eng: Basil would be sure to do that.
fr: Basil le ferait surement.

eng: No; the thing had to be examined, and at once.
fr: Il lui fallait examiner a nouveau la toile...

eng: Anything would be better than this dreadful state of doubt.
fr: Tout, plutot que cet infernal etat de doute !...

eng: He got up and locked both doors.
fr: Il se leva et alla fermer les deux portes.

eng: At least he would be alone when he looked upon the mask of his shame.
fr: Au moins, il serait seul a contempler le masque de sa honte...

eng: He shuddered, and felt afraid, and, going back to the couch, lay there, gazing at the picture in sickened horror.
fr: Il frissonna, effraye... Retournant vers le divan, il s'y laissa tomber, regardant, hagard, le portrait en fremissant d'horreur !...

eng: One thing, however, he felt that it had done for him.
fr: Cette chose avait eu, toutefois, un effet sur lui...

eng: It had made him conscious how unjust, how cruel, he had been to Sibyl Vane.
fr: Il devenait conscient de son injustice et de sa cruaute envers Sibyl Vane...

eng: Suddenly there came a knock to the door, and he heard Lord Henry s voice outside.
fr: On frappa tout a coup a la porte et il entendit en dehors la voix de lord Henry : -- Mon cher ami, il faut que je vous parle.

eng: "My dear boy, I must see you.
fr: Laissez-moi entrer.

eng: Let me in at once. ~~~ I can t bear your shutting yourself up like this."
fr: Je ne puis supporter de vous voir ainsi barricade...

eng: He jumped up, drew the screen hastily across the picture, and unlocked the door.
fr: Il se dressa, alla en hate tirer le paravent sur le portrait, et ota le verrou de la porte.

eng: "I am so sorry for it all, Dorian," said Lord Henry as he entered.
fr: -- Je suis vraiment fache de mon insistance, Dorian, dit lord Henry en entrant.

eng: "But you must not think too much about it."
fr: Mais vous ne devez pas trop songer a cela.

eng: "It is dreadful, from one point of view, but it was not your fault.
fr: C'est terrible, a un certain point de vue mais ce n'est pas votre faute.

eng: Tell me, did you go behind and see her, after the play was over?"
fr: Dites-moi, est-ce que vous etes alle dans les coulisses apres la piece ?

eng: "Yes." ~~~ "I felt sure you had.
fr: -- Oui... -- J'en etais sur.

eng: Did you make a scene with her?"
fr: Vous lui fites une scene ?

eng: "I was brutal, Harry perfectly brutal.
fr: -- Je fus brutal, Harry, parfaitement brutal.

eng: But it is all right now.
fr: Mais c'est fini maintenant.

eng: I am not sorry for anything that has happened.
fr: Je ne suis pas fache que cela soit arrive.

eng: It has taught me to know myself better."
fr: Cela m'a appris a me mieux connaitre. ~~~ -- Ah !

eng: I was afraid I would find you plunged in remorse and tearing that nice curly hair of yours."
fr: J'avais peur de vous voir plonge dans le remords, et vous arrachant vos beaux cheveux boucles... -- Ah, non, j'en ai fini !...

eng: "I have got through all that," said Dorian, shaking his head and smiling.
fr: dit Dorian, secouant la tete en souriant...

eng: "I am perfectly happy now.
I know what conscience is, to begin with.
fr: Je suis a present parfaitement heureux...

eng: It is not what you told me it was. ~~~ It is the divinest thing in us. ~~~ Don t sneer at it, Harry, any more at least not before me.
fr: Je sais ce qu'est la conscience, pour commencer ; ce n'est pas ce que vous m'aviez dit ; c'est la plus divine chose qui soit en nous... Ne vous en moquez plus, Harry, au moins devant moi.

eng: cried Lord Henry, standing up and looking at him in perplexed amazement.
fr: s'ecria lord Henry, sursautant et le regardant avec un etonnement perplexe.

eng: "But, my dear Dorian " "Yes, Harry, I know what you are going to say.
fr: Mais, mon cher Dorian... -- Oui, Harry.

eng: Something dreadful about marriage. ~~~ Don t say it.
fr: Je sais ce que vous m'allez dire : un ereintement du mariage ; ne le developpez pas.

eng: Don t ever say things of that kind to me again.
fr: Ne me dites plus rien de nouveau la-dessus.
J'ai offert, il y a deux jours, a Sibyl Vane de l'epouser ; je ne veux point lui manquer de parole : elle sera ma femme... -- Votre femme, Dorian !...

eng: Two days ago I asked Sibyl to marry me.
fr: N'avez-vous donc pas recu ma lettre ?...

eng: I am not going to break my word to her. ~~~ She is to be my wife."
fr: Je vous ai ecrit ce matin et vous ai fait tenir la lettre par mon domestique.

eng: "Your wife! ~~~ Dorian!
fr: -- Votre lettre ?...
Ah !

eng: Didn t you get my letter?
I wrote to you this morning, and sent the note down by my own man."
"Your letter?
Oh, yes, I remember.
fr: oui, je me souviens !

eng: I was afraid there might be something in it that I wouldn t like.
fr: Je craignais d'y trouver quelque chose qui me ferait de la peine.

eng: You cut life to pieces with your epigrams."
fr: Vous m'empoisonnez la vie avec vos epigrammes.

eng: "You know nothing then?"
fr: -- Vous ne connaissez donc rien ?...

eng: "What do you mean?"
fr: -- Que voulez-vous dire ?...

eng: Lord Henry walked across the room, and sitting down by Dorian Gray, took both his hands in his own and held them tightly.
fr: Lord Henry traversa la chambre, et s'asseyant a cote de Dorian Gray, lui prit les deux mains dans les siennes, et les lui serrant etroitement : -- Dorian, lui dit-il, ma lettre -- ne vous effrayez pas !

eng: "Dorian," he said, "my letter don t be frightened was to tell you that Sibyl Vane is dead."
fr: -- vous informait de la mort de Sibyl Vane !...

eng: A cry of pain broke from the lad s lips, and he leaped to his feet, tearing his hands away from Lord Henry s grasp. ~~~ "Dead!
fr: Un cri de douleur jaillit des levres de l'adolescent ; il bondit sur ses pieds, s'arrachant de l'etreinte de lord Henry : -- Morte !...

eng: "It is in all the morning papers.
fr: C'est dans les journaux de ce matin.

eng: I wrote down to you to ask you not to see any one till I came.
There will have to be an inquest, of course, and you must not be mixed up in it.
fr: Je vous ecrivais pour vous dire de ne recevoir personne jusqu'a mon arrivee.

eng: Things like that make a man fashionable in Paris. ~~~ But in London people are so prejudiced.
fr: Il y aura une enquete dans laquelle il ne faut pas que vous soyez mele.

eng: Here, one should never make one s _d but_ with a scandal. ~~~ One should reserve that to give an interest to one s old age.
fr: Des choses comme celles-la, mettent un homme a la mode a Paris, mais a Londres on a tant de prejuges... Ici, on ne debute jamais avec un scandale ; on reserve cela pour donner un interet a ses vieux jours.

eng: I suppose they don t know your name at the theatre? ~~~ If they don t, it is all right.
fr: J'aime a croire qu'on ne connait pas votre nom au theatre ; s'il en est ainsi, tout va bien.

eng: Did any one see you going round to her room?
fr: Personne ne vous vit aux alentours de sa loge ?

eng: That is an important point."
fr: Ceci est de toute importance ?

eng: Dorian did not answer for a few moments.
fr: Dorian ne repondit point pendant quelques instants.

eng: Finally he stammered, in a stifled voice, "Harry, did you say an inquest?
fr: Il balbutia enfin d'une voix etouffee : -- Harry, vous parlez d'enquete ?

eng: What did you mean by that?
fr: Que voulez-vous dire ?

eng: Did Sibyl ?
fr: Sibyl aurait-elle ?...

eng: But be quick.
fr: Mais parlez vite !

eng: Tell me everything at once."
fr: Dites-moi tout !...

eng: "I have no doubt it was not an accident, Dorian, though it must be put in that way to the public.
fr: -- Je n'ai aucun doute ; ce n'est pas un accident, Dorian, quoique le public puisse le croire.

eng: "Yes; it is very tragic, of course, but you must not get yourself mixed up in it.
fr: -- Oui, c'est vraiment tragique, c'est sur, mais il ne faut pas que vous y soyez mele.

eng: I see by _The Standard_ that she was seventeen. ~~~ I should have thought she was almost younger than that.
fr: J'ai vu dans le Standard qu'elle avait dix-sept ans ; j'aurais cru qu'elle etait plus jeune, elle avait l'air d'une enfant et savait si peu jouer... Dorian, ne vous frappez pas !...

eng: She looked such a child, and seemed to know so little about acting.
fr: Venez diner avec moi, et apres nous irons a l'Opera.

eng: Dorian, you mustn t let this thing get on your nerves.
You must come and dine with me, and afterwards we will look in at the opera.
It is a Patti night, and everybody will be there.
fr: La Patti joue ce soir, et tout le monde sera la.

eng: You can come to my sister s box.

She has got some smart women with her." ~~~ "So I have murdered Sibyl Vane," said Dorian Gray, half to himself, "murdered her as surely as if I had cut her little throat with a knife. ~~~ Yet the roses are not less lovely for all that.
fr: Vous viendrez dans la loge de ma soeur ; il s'y trouvera quelques jolies femmes... -- Ainsi, j'ai tue Sibyl Vane, murmurait Dorian, je l'ai tuee aussi surement que si j'avais coupe sa petite gorge avec un couteau... et cependant les roses pour cela n'en sont pas moins belles... les oiseaux n'en chanteront pas moins dans mon jardin... Et ce soir, je vais aller diner avec vous : j'irai de la a l'Opera, et, sans doute, j'irai souper quelque part ensuite... Combien la vie est puissamment dramatique !...

eng: The birds sing just as happily in my garden. ~~~ And to-night I am to dine with you, and then go on to the opera, and sup somewhere, I suppose, afterwards. ~~~ How extraordinarily dramatic life is!
fr: Si j'avais lu cela dans un livre, Harry, je pense que j'en aurais pleure... Maintenant que cela arrive, et a moi, cela me semble beaucoup trop stupefiant pour en pleurer !...

eng: If I had read all this in a book, Harry, I think I would have wept over it. ~~~ Somehow, now that it has happened actually, and to me, it seems far too wonderful for tears. ~~~ Here is the first passionate love-letter I have ever written in my life.
fr: Tenez, voici la premiere lettre d'amour passionnee que j'ai jamais ecrite de ma vie ; ne trouvez-vous pas etrange que cette premiere lettre d'amour soit adressee a une fille morte !...

eng: Strange, that my first passionate love-letter should have been addressed to a dead girl.
fr: Peuvent-elles sentir, ces choses blanches et silencieuses que nous appelons les morts ?

eng: Can they feel, I wonder, those white silent people we call the dead?
Sibyl!
fr: Sibyl !

eng: Can she feel, or know, or listen?
fr: Peut-elle sentir, savoir, ecouter ?

eng: Oh, Harry, how I loved her once!
fr: Oh ! ~~~ Harry, comme je l'aimais !

eng: It seems years ago to me now.
fr: Il me semble qu'il y a des annees !...

eng: She was everything to me. ~~~ Then came that dreadful night was it really only last night?
fr: << Elle m'etait tout... Vint cet affreux soir -- etait-ce la nuit derniere ?

eng: when she played so badly, and my heart almost broke.
fr: -- ou elle joua si mal, et mon coeur se brisa !

eng: She explained it all to me.
fr: Elle m'expliqua pourquoi ?

eng: It was terribly pathetic.
fr: Ce fut horriblement touchant !

eng: But I was not moved a bit. ~~~ I thought her shallow.
fr: Je ne fus pas emu : je la croyais sotte !...

eng: I can t tell you what it was, but it was terrible.
fr: Je ne puis vous dire ce que ce fut, mais ce fut terrible...

eng: I said I would go back to her. ~~~ I felt I had done wrong. ~~~ And now she is dead.
fr: Je voulus retourner a elle ; je sentis que je m'etais mal conduit... et maintenant elle est morte !

eng: My God!
fr: Mon Dieu !

eng: Harry, what shall I do?
fr: Harry, que dois-je faire ?

eng: You don t know the danger I am in, and there is nothing to keep me straight.
fr: Vous savez dans quel danger je suis, et rien n'est la pour m'en garder !

eng: She would have done that for me.
fr: Elle aurait fait cela pour moi !

eng: "My dear Dorian," answered Lord Henry, taking a cigarette from his case and producing a gold-latten matchbox, "the only way a woman can ever reform a man is by boring him so completely that he loses all possible interest in life. ~~~ If you had married this girl, you would have been wretched.
fr: -- Mon cher Dorian, repondit lord Henry, prenant une cigarette et tirant de sa poche une boite d'allumettes doree, la seule maniere dont une femme puisse reformer un homme est de l'importuner de telle sorte qu'il perd tout interet possible a l'existence.

eng: Of course, you would have treated her kindly. ~~~ One can always be kind to people about whom one cares nothing. ~~~ But she would have soon found out that you were absolutely indifferent to her.
fr: Si vous aviez epouse cette jeune fille, vous auriez ete malheureux ; vous l'auriez traitee gentiment ; on peut toujours etre bon envers les personnes desquelles on attend rien.

eng: And when a woman finds that out about her husband, she either becomes dreadfully dowdy, or wears very smart bonnets that some other woman s husband has to pay for.
fr: Mais elle aurait bientot decouvert que vous lui etiez absolument indifferent, et quand une femme a decouvert cela de son mari, ou elle se fagote terriblement, ou bien elle porte de pimpants chapeaux que paie le mari... d'une autre femme.

eng: I say nothing about the social mistake, which would have been abject which, of course, I would not have allowed but I assure you that in any case the whole thing would have been an absolute failure."
fr: Je ne dis rien de l'adultere, qui aurait pu etre abject, qu'en somme je n'aurais pas permis, mais je vous assure en tous les cas, que tout cela eut ete un parfait malentendu.

eng: "I suppose it would," muttered the lad, walking up and down the room and looking horribly pale. ~~~ "But I thought it was my duty. ~~~ It is not my fault that this terrible tragedy has prevented my doing what was right.
fr: -- C'est possible, murmura le jeune homme horriblement pale, en marchant de long en large dans la chambre ; mais je pensais que cela etait de mon devoir ; ce n'est point ma faute si ce drame terrible m'a empeche de faire ce que je croyais juste.

eng: They give us, now and then, some of those luxurious sterile emotions that have a certain charm for the weak.
fr: De temps a autre, elles nous donnent quelques luxueuses emotions steriles qui possedent, pour les faibles, un certain charme.

eng: That is all that can be said for them.
fr: Voila ce que l'on peut en deduire.

eng: They are simply cheques that men draw on a bank where they have no account."
fr: On peut les comparer a des cheques qu'un homme tirerait sur une banque ou il n'aurait point de compte ouvert.

eng: "You have done too many foolish things during the last fortnight to be entitled to give yourself that name, Dorian," answered Lord Henry with his sweet melancholy smile. ~~~ The lad frowned.
fr: -- Vous avez fait trop de folies durant la derniere quinzaine pour qu'il vous soit permis de vous croire ainsi, Dorian, repondit lord Henry avec son doux et melancolique sourire.

eng: "I don t like that explanation, Harry," he rejoined, "but I am glad you don t think I am heartless.
I am nothing of the kind. ~~~ I know I am not.
fr: Le jeune homme fronca les sourcils.

eng: And yet I must admit that this thing that has happened does not affect me as it should. ~~~ It seems to me to be simply like a wonderful ending to a wonderful play.
fr: -- Je n'aime point cette explication, Harry, reprit-il, mais cela me fait plaisir d'apprendre que vous ne me croyez pas sans coeur ; je ne le suis vraiment pas, je le sais... Et cependant je me rends compte que je ne suis affecte par cette chose comme je le devrais etre ; elle me semble simplement etre le merveilleux epilogue d'un merveilleux drame.

eng: In the present case, what is it that has really happened?
fr: << Qu'est-il reellement arrive dans le cas qui nous occupe ?

eng: Some one has killed herself for love of you.
fr: Une femme s'est tuee par amour pour vous.

eng: I wish that I had ever had such an experience. ~~~ It would have made me in love with love for the rest of my life.
fr: Je suis ravi que pareille chose ne me soit jamais arrivee ; cela m'aurait fait aimer l'amour pour le restant de mes jours.

eng: The people who have adored me there have not been very many, but there have been some have always insisted on living on, long after I had ceased to care for them, or they to care for me.
fr: Les femmes qui m'ont adore -- elles n'ont pas ete nombreuses, mais il y en a eu -- ont voulu continuer, alors que depuis longtemps j'avais cesse d'y preter attention, ou elles de faire attention a moi.

eng: They have become stout and tedious, and when I meet them, they go in at once for reminiscences.
fr: Elles sont devenues grasses et assommantes et quand je les rencontre, elles entament le chapitre des reminiscences... Oh !

eng: I once wore nothing but violets all through one season, as a form of artistic mourning for a romance that would not die.
fr: Une fois, je ne portais que des violettes toute une saison, comme maniere artistique de porter le deuil d'une passion qui ne voulait mourir.

eng: Ultimately, however, it did die.
fr: Enfin, elle mourut, je ne sais ce qui la tua.

eng: I forget what killed it. ~~~ I think it was her proposing to sacrifice the whole world for me. ~~~ That is always a dreadful moment. ~~~ It fills one with the terror of eternity.
fr: Je pense que ce fut la proposition de sacrifier le monde entier pour moi ; c'est toujours un moment ennuyeux : cela vous remplit de la terreur de l'eternite.

eng: Well would you believe it?
fr: Eh bien !

eng: a week ago, at Lady Hampshire s, I found myself seated at dinner next the lady in question, and she insisted on going over the whole thing again, and digging up the past, and raking up the future.
fr: le croyez-vous, il y a une semaine, je me trouvai chez lady Hampshire, assis au diner pres de la dame en question et elle insista pour recommencer de nouveau, en deblayant le passe et ratissant le futur.

eng: I had buried my romance in a bed of asphodel. ~~~ She dragged it out again and assured me that I had spoiled her life.
fr: J'avais enterre mon roman dans un lit d'asphodeles ; elle pretendait l'exhumer et m'assurait que je n'avais pas gate sa vie.

eng: I am bound to state that she ate an enormous dinner, so I did not feel any anxiety.
fr: Je suis autorise a croire qu'elle mangea enormement ; aussi ne ressentis-je aucune anxiete...

eng: Conscience makes egotists of us all. ~~~ Yes; there is really no end to the consolations that women find in modern life. ~~~ Indeed, I have not mentioned the most important one." ~~~ "What is that, Harry?"
fr: La conscience fait de nous des egoistes... Oui, il n'y a reellement pas de fin aux consolations que les femmes trouvent dans la vie moderne, et je n'ai point encore mentionne la plus importante.

eng: said the lad listlessly.
fr: -- Quelle est-elle, Harry ?

eng: "Oh, the obvious consolation.
fr: demanda indifferemment le jeune homme.

eng: Taking some one else s admirer when one loses one s own.
fr: -- La consolation evidente : prendre un nouvel adorateur quand on en perd un.

eng: In good society that always whitewashes a woman.
fr: Dans la bonne societe, cela vous rajeunit toujours une femme...

eng: But really, Dorian, how different Sibyl Vane must have been from all the women one meets! ~~~ There is something to me quite beautiful about her death.
fr: Mais reellement, Dorian, combien Sibyl Vane devait etre dissemblable des femmes que nous rencontrons.

eng: I am glad I am living in a century when such wonders happen.
fr: Il y a quelque chose d'absolument beau dans sa mort.

eng: They make one believe in the reality of the things we all play with, such as romance, passion, and love."
fr: << Je suis heureux de vivre dans un siecle ou de pareils miracles se produisent.

eng: "I was terribly cruel to her. ~~~ You forget that." ~~~ "I am afraid that women appreciate cruelty, downright cruelty, more than anything else.
fr: Ils nous font croire a la realite des choses avec lesquelles nous jouons, comme le roman, la passion, l'amour... -- Je fus bien cruel envers elle, vous l'oubliez... -- Je suis certain que les femmes apprecient la cruaute, la vraie cruaute, plus que n'importe quoi.

eng: I am sure you were splendid.
fr: Je suis sur que vous futes splendide !...

eng: I have never seen you really and absolutely angry, but I can fancy how delightful you looked.
fr: Je ne vous ai jamais vu dans une veritable colere, mais je m'imagine combien vous devez etre charmant.

eng: And, after all, you said something to me the day before yesterday that seemed to me at the time to be merely fanciful, but that I see now was absolutely true, and it holds the key to everything." ~~~ "What was that, Harry?"
fr: Et d'ailleurs, vous m'avez dit quelque chose avant-hier, qui me parut alors quelque peu fantaisiste, mais que je sens maintenant parfaitement vrai, et qui me donne la clef de tout... -- Qu'etait-ce, Harry ?

eng: There was a silence.
fr: Un silence suivit.

eng: The evening darkened in the room. ~~~ Noiselessly, and with silver feet, the shadows crept in from the garden.
fr: Le crepuscule assombrissait la chambre ; sans bruit, a pas de velours, les ombres se glissaient dans le jardin.

eng: The colours faded wearily out of things.
fr: Les couleurs des objets s'evanouissaient paresseusement.

eng: After some time Dorian Gray looked up.
fr: Apres quelques minutes, Dorian Gray releva la tete... -- Vous m'avez explique a moi-meme, Harry, murmura-t-il avec un soupir de soulagement.

eng: "You have explained me to myself, Harry," he murmured with something of a sigh of relief. ~~~ "I felt all that you have said, but somehow I was afraid of it, and I could not express it to myself.
fr: Je sentais tout ce que vous m'avez dit, mais en quelque sorte, j'en etais effraye et je n'osais me l'exprimer a moi-meme.

eng: But we will not talk again of what has happened. ~~~ It has been a marvellous experience.
fr: Mais nous ne parlerons plus de ce qui est arrive ; ce fut une merveilleuse experience, c'est tout.

eng: That is all. ~~~ I wonder if life has still in store for me anything as marvellous."
fr: Je ne crois pas que la vie me reserve encore quelque chose d'aussi merveilleux.

eng: "Life has everything in store for you, Dorian.
fr: -- La vie a tout en reserve pour vous, Dorian.

eng: "Ah, then," said Lord Henry, rising to go, "then, my dear Dorian, you would have to fight for your victories. ~~~ As it is, they are brought to you.
fr: -- Alors, reprit lord Henry en se levant, alors, mon cher Dorian, vous aurez a combattre pour vos victoires ; actuellement, elles vous sont apportees.

eng: No, you must keep your good looks.
fr: Il faut que vous gardiez votre beaute.

eng: We live in an age that reads too much to be wise, and that thinks too much to be beautiful.
fr: Nous vivons dans un siecle qui lit trop pour etre sage et qui pense trop pour etre beau.

eng: We cannot spare you. ~~~ And now you had better dress and drive down to the club.
fr: Vous ne pouvons nous passer de vous... Maintenant, ce que vous avez de mieux a faire, c'est d'aller vous habiller et de descendre au club.

eng: We are rather late, as it is."
fr: Nous sommes plutot en retard comme vous le voyez.

eng: "Twenty-seven, I believe.
fr: -- Vingt-sept, je crois.

eng: It is on the grand tier. ~~~ You will see her name on the door.
fr: C'est au premier rang ; vous verrez son nom sur la porte.

eng: But I am sorry you won t come and dine."
fr: Je suis desole que vous ne veniez diner.

eng: "I don t feel up to it," said Dorian listlessly.
fr: -- Ca ne m'est point possible, dit Dorian nonchalamment...

eng: When he thought of her, it would be as a wonderful tragic figure sent on to the world s stage to show the supreme reality of love.
fr: Quand il penserait a elle, ce serait comme a une prestigieuse figure tragique envoyee sur la scene du monde pour y montrer la realite supreme de l'Amour.

eng: A wonderful tragic figure?
fr: Une prestigieuse figure tragique !

eng: Tears came to his eyes as he remembered her childlike look, and winsome fanciful ways, and shy tremulous grace.
fr: Des larmes lui monterent aux yeux, en se souvenant de son air enfantin, de ses manieres douces et capricieuses, de sa farouche et tremblante grace.

eng: Was it to become a monstrous and loathsome thing, to be hidden away in a locked room, to be shut out from the sunlight that had so often touched to brighter gold the waving wonder of its hair?
fr: Cela deviendrait-il un monstrueux et degoutant objet a cacher dans quelque chambre cadenassee, loin de la lumiere du soleil qui avait si souvent leche l'or eclatant de sa chevelure ondee ?

eng: The pity of it! ~~~ the pity of it!
fr: Quelle derision sans mesure !

eng: For a moment, he thought of praying that the horrible sympathy that existed between him and the picture might cease.
fr: Un instant, il songea a prier pour que cessat l'horrible sympathie existant entre lui et le portrait.

eng: It had changed in answer to a prayer; perhaps in answer to a prayer it might remain unchanged.
fr: Une priere l'avait faite ; peut-etre une priere la pouvait-elle detruire ?...

eng: And yet, who, that knew anything about life, would surrender the chance of remaining always young, however fantastic that chance might be, or with what fateful consequences it might be fraught?
fr: Cependant, qui, connaissant la vie, hesiterait pour garder la chance de rester toujours jeune, quelque fantastique que cette chance put paraitre, a tenter les consequences que ce choix pouvait entrainer ?...

eng: He would never again tempt by a prayer any terrible power.
fr: Il ne tenterait plus par la priere un si terrible pouvoir.

eng: If the picture was to alter, it was to alter.
fr: Si la peinture devait s'alterer, rien ne pouvait l'empecher.

eng: That was all.
fr: C'etait clair.

eng: Why inquire too closely into it?
fr: Pourquoi approfondir cela ?

eng: He drew the screen back into its former place in front of the picture, smiling as he did so, and passed into his bedroom, where his valet was already waiting for him.
fr: Souriant, il replaca le paravent dans la position qu'il occupait devant le portrait, et passa dans la chambre ou l'attendait son valet.

eng: An hour later he was at the opera, and Lord Henry was leaning over his chair. ~~~ CHAPTER IX.
fr: Une heure plus tard, il etait a l'Opera, et lord Henry s'appuyait sur le dos de son fauteuil.

eng: As he was sitting at breakfast next morning, Basil Hallward was shown into the room.
fr: IX Le lendemain matin, tandis qu'il dejeunait, Basil Hallward entra.

eng: "I am so glad I have found you, Dorian," he said gravely.
fr: -- Je suis bien heureux de vous trouver, Dorian, dit-il gravement.

eng: "I called last night, and they told me you were at the opera.
fr: Je suis venu hier soir et on m'a dit que vous etiez a l'Opera.

eng: Of course, I knew that was impossible.
fr: Je savais que c'etait impossible.

eng: But I wish you had left word where you had really gone to.
fr: Mais j'aurais voulu que vous m'eussiez laisse un mot, me disant ou vous etiez alle.

eng: I passed a dreadful evening, half afraid that one tragedy might be followed by another.
fr: J'ai passe une bien triste soiree, craignant qu'une premiere tragedie soit suivie d'une autre.

eng: I think you might have telegraphed for me when you heard of it first.
fr: Vous auriez du me telegraphier des que vous en avez entendu parler.

eng: I read of it quite by chance in a late edition of _The Globe_ that I picked up at the club.
fr: Je l'ai lu par hasard dans la derniere edition du Globe au club.

eng: I came here at once and was miserable at not finding you.
fr: Je vins aussitot ici et je fus vraiment desole de ne pas vous trouver.

eng: I can t tell you how heart-broken I am about the whole thing.
fr: Je ne saurais vous dire combien j'ai eu le coeur brise par tout cela.

eng: But where were you?
fr: Mais ou etiez-vous ?

eng: Did you go down and see the girl s mother?
fr: Etes-vous alle voir la mere de la pauvre fille ?

eng: For a moment I thought of following you there.
fr: Un instant, J'avais songe a vous y chercher.

eng: And her only child, too!
fr: Son unique enfant !...

eng: What did she say about it all?"
fr: Que disait-elle ?

eng: "My dear Basil, how do I know?"
fr: -- Mon cher Basil, que sais-je ?

eng: murmured Dorian Gray, sipping some pale-yellow wine from a delicate, gold-beaded bubble of Venetian glass and looking dreadfully bored.
fr: murmura Dorian Gray en buvant a petits coups d'un vin jaune pale dans un verre de Venise, delicatement contourne et dore, en paraissant profondement ennuye.

eng: "I was at the opera. ~~~ You should have come on there.
fr: J'etais a l'Opera, vous auriez du y venir.

eng: I met Lady Gwendolen, Harry s sister, for the first time.
fr: J'ai rencontre pour la premiere fois lady Gwendoline, la soeur d'Harry.

eng: It is simply expression, as Harry says, that gives reality to things.
fr: C'est seulement l'expression, comme dit Harry, qui donne une realite aux choses.

eng: I may mention that she was not the woman s only child.
fr: Je dois dire que ce n'etait pas l'unique enfant de la pauvre femme.

eng: There is a son, a charming fellow, I believe.
fr: Il y a un fils, un charmant garcon je crois.

eng: But he is not on the stage.
fr: Mais il n'est pas au theatre.

eng: He is a sailor, or something.
fr: C'est un marin, ou quelque chose comme cela.

eng: Why, man, there are horrors in store for that little white body of hers!"
fr: Vous ne songez donc pas aux horreurs reservees a ce petit corps lilial !

eng: "Stop, Basil! ~~~ I won t hear it!"
fr: -- Arretez-vous, Basil, je ne veux pas les entendre !

eng: cried Dorian, leaping to his feet.
fr: s'ecria Dorian en se levant.

eng: "You must not tell me about things.
fr: Ne me parlez pas de ces choses.

eng: What is done is done.
fr: Ce qui est fait est fait.

eng: What is past is past."
fr: Le passe est le passe.

eng: "You call yesterday the past?"
fr: -- Vous appelez hier le passe ?

eng: "What has the actual lapse of time got to do with it?
fr: -- Ce qui se passe dans l'instant actuel va lui appartenir.

eng: It is only shallow people who require years to get rid of an emotion.
fr: Il n'y a que les gens superficiels qui veulent des annees pour s'affranchir d'une emotion.

eng: But you were simple, natural, and affectionate then.
fr: Mais alors vous etiez simple, naturel et tendre.

eng: You were the most unspoiled creature in the whole world.
fr: Vous etiez la moins souillee des creatures.

eng: Now, I don t know what has come over you.
fr: Maintenant je ne sais ce qui a passe sur vous.

eng: You talk as if you had no heart, no pity in you.
fr: Vous parlez comme si vous n'aviez ni coeur ni pitie.

eng: It is all Harry s influence. ~~~ I see that."
fr: C'est l'influence d'Harry qui a fait cela, je le vois bien...

eng: The lad flushed up and, going to the window, looked out for a few moments on the green, flickering, sun-lashed garden.
fr: Le jeune homme rougit et allant a la fenetre, resta quelques instants a considerer la pelouse fleurie et ensoleillee.

eng: You only taught me to be vain."
fr: Vous ne m'avez appris qu'a etre vain.
-- Parfait ?...

eng: "Well, I am punished for that, Dorian or shall be some day."
fr: aussi en suis-je puni, Dorian, ou le serai-je quelque jour.

eng: "I don t know what you mean, Basil," he exclaimed, turning round.
fr: -- Je ne sais ce que vous voulez dire, Basil, s'ecria-t-il en se retournant.

eng: "I don t know what you want.
fr: Je ne sais ce que vous voulez !

eng: What do you want?"
fr: Que voulez-vous ?

eng: Yesterday, when I heard that Sibyl Vane had killed herself " "Killed herself! ~~~ Good heavens!
fr: Hier lorsque j'appris que Sibyl Vane s'etait suicidee... -- Suicidee, mon Dieu !

eng: is there no doubt about that?"
fr: est-ce bien certain ?

eng: cried Hallward, looking up at him with an expression of horror.
fr: s'ecria Hallward le regardant avec une expression d'horreur... -- Mon cher Basil !

eng: "My dear Basil! ~~~ Surely you don t think it was a vulgar accident?
fr: Vous ne pensiez surement pas que ce fut un vulgaire accident.

eng: Of course she killed herself."
fr: Certainement, elle s'est suicidee.

eng: The elder man buried his face in his hands.
fr: L'autre enfonca sa tete dans ses mains.

eng: "How fearful," he muttered, and a shudder ran through him.
fr: -- C'est effrayant, murmura-t-il, tandis qu'un frisson le parcourait.

eng: She was always a heroine.
fr: Elle fut constamment une heroine.

eng: The last night she played the night you saw her she acted badly because she had known the reality of love.
fr: La derniere nuit qu'elle joua, la nuit ou vous la vites, elle joua mal parce qu'elle avait compris la realite de l'amour.

eng: When she knew its unreality, she died, as Juliet might have died.
fr: Quand elle connut ses deceptions, elle mourut comme Juliette eut pu mourir.

eng: I cannot repeat an emotion.
fr: Je ne puis repeter une emotion.

eng: No one can, except sentimentalists.
And you are awfully unjust, Basil. ~~~ You come down here to console me.
fr: Personne d'ailleurs ne le peut, excepte les sentimentaux.

eng: That is charming of you. ~~~ You find me consoled, and you are furious.
fr: Et vous etes cruellement injuste, Basil : vous venez ici pour me consoler, ce qui est charmant de votre part ; vous me trouvez tout console et vous etes furieux !...

eng: You remind me of a story Harry told me about a certain philanthropist who spent twenty years of his life in trying to get some grievance redressed, or some unjust law altered I forget exactly what it was.
fr: Vous me rappelez une histoire qu'Harry m'a racontee a propos d'un certain philanthrope qui depensa vingt ans de sa vie a essayer de redresser quelque tort, ou de modifier une loi injuste, je ne sais plus exactement.

eng: Finally he succeeded, and nothing could exceed his disappointment.
fr: Enfin il y reussit, et rien ne put surpasser son desespoir.

eng: He had absolutely nothing to do, almost died of _ennui_, and became a confirmed misanthrope.
fr: Il n'avait absolument plus rien a faire, sinon a mourir d'ennui et il devint un misanthrope resolu.

eng: You have not realized how I have developed.
fr: Vous n'avez pas compris comment je me suis developpe.

eng: I was a schoolboy when you knew me. ~~~ I am a man now.
